Tequila would be a fantastic choice for the Mango Habanero Mule! Tequila's bold, agave-forward flavor will complement the sweetness of the mango and the heat of the habanero peppers perfectly.

When substituting tequila for vodka, keep in mind that tequila has a stronger flavor profile, so you may want to adjust the amount of habanero pepper syrup accordingly. Here's a suggestion:

* Start with a smaller amount of habanero pepper syrup, such as 1/4 oz (15 ml) or even 1/2 oz (15 ml) if you prefer a milder heat level.
* Taste the drink as you go and adjust the amount of habanero pepper syrup to your liking. You can always add more, but it's harder to remove the heat once it's added.

Tequila's flavor profile will also change the overall character of the drink. You might find that the habanero pepper syrup will blend more seamlessly with the tequila, creating a more harmonious balance of flavors.

Additionally, consider the type of tequila you're using. A blanco or silver tequila will provide a crisp, agave-forward flavor, while a reposado or añejo tequila will add a richer, more aged flavor profile. This might influence the amount of habanero pepper syrup you use and the overall flavor balance of the drink.

Here's an updated recipe to get you started:

**Mango Habanero Mule (Tequila Version)**

* 2 oz (60 ml) tequila (blanco or reposado work well)
* 1/2 oz (15 ml) mango puree
* 1/2 oz (15 ml) lime juice
* 1/4 oz (7.5 ml) habanero pepper syrup (adjust to taste)
* Ginger beer
* Ice
* Lime wheel and slice of mango for garnish

Shake the tequila, mango puree, lime juice, and habanero pepper syrup with ice. Strain into a copper mug or highball glass filled with ice. Top with ginger beer and garnish with a lime wheel and slice of mango.

Experiment with different tequilas and habanero pepper syrup levels to find the perfect balance of flavors for your Mango Habanero Mule!
